name: Callisto
headline: We create tech to combat sexual assault, support survivors, andâ¦
description: Callisto is a nonprofit tech startup that detects serial sexual offenders and connects survivors with support. Callisto's online system launched in 2015, and is currently available on over 40 college campuses. In 2020, we launched a new offering that combines our unique matching escrow with legal services, ensuring that eventually every survivor in the country will be able to safely coordinate action and share information with other victims of the same perpetrator.
tags: industry:nonprofit; industry:legaltech; industry:health-&-wellness; industry:trust-&-safety; industry:diversity-&-inclusion; location:san-francisco-bay-area

![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/477b1ab1-dd8c-4e8f-b92b-1bebb3fbe891/website+header+extra+space.png)
### Want to find out if your perpetrator harmed someone else? With Callisto, you can.
[ Learn More ](https://www.projectcallisto.org/</callistovault>)
**_Ending serial sexual assault…one match at a time._**
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/f5d20883-3440-4dcb-ac0a-769022e8f380/campus.png)
# **2.5M**
college students are sexually assaulted each year
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/a2d1af9c-c5d4-4700-aca0-566e7e7fd8b2/perps.png)
# **90%**
of campus assaults are committed by **serial offenders**
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/fc723d29-f230-4f20-9f84-408f7837737b/police.png)
# **6%**
of student survivors report to Title IX or the police
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/ee4aac83-3201-4e41-8542-0a46b1bbecd8/MeToo+Background+copy.jpg)
### **#MeToo Reckoning**
#### The #MeToo movement and subsequent tidal wave of accusations and lawsuits against powerful men like Harvey Weinstein and Bill Cosby forced society to reckon with the pervasiveness of sexual violence. Many also witnessed the risks of coming forward, how frequently perpetrators are serial offenders, and how rarely they face justice.
#### While many survivors felt more empowered, their options for coming forward safely remained limited. Filing a formal report was often retraumatizing, and relying on whisper networks exposed survivors and journalists to defamation lawsuits.
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/0ee79105-ec4f-45f7-8371-75968608c3e5/hi+res+solution+2.png)
### **Our Solution**
Callisto leverages cutting-edge technology to empower campus survivors, provide a safe alternative to reporting, and increase the likelihood that serial offenders will be held accountable. Our encrypted platform, Callisto Vault, allows survivors to create a timestamped record of their assault and/or match with others harmed by the same perpetrator.
[ Learn More ](https://www.projectcallisto.org/</callistovault>)
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/5563a07f-0996-476c-871c-45dfd495b13c/Website+Image+-+Technology.png)
### **Our Technology**
  * Can be used whether or not a survivor chooses to report or disclose publicly
  * Helps survivors process their trauma and make informed decisions about if/how to proceed
  * Protects against defamation, as both survivor and perpetrator information is encrypted and secure
  * Safely connects survivors of serial offenders, increasing the likelihood that perpetrators will be held accountable


[ Create an Account ](https://www.projectcallisto.org/<https:/www.callistovault.org/create-account>)
  * ## “Callisto was my safety net. I knew once I entered that system that one day I would find the person who made me less alone. And that was what I needed to feel whole again and to start healing.”
Ray Epstein, Callisto Ambassador
  * ## "Since that original match, I’ve learned about multiple other students on my campus who were harmed by the same perpetrator. Not a single one of us knew the behavior was serial. We had all been fed the same lies— that we were being overdramatic, the behavior was a mistake, the perpetrator felt so, so terrible over what happened, and it would never happen again. We had another trend in common. We each wanted to report, but couldn't do it alone. Thanks to Callisto, we weren't." 
Anonymous Matched Survivor
  * ## "Representing campus survivors, I see how often perpetrators are serial offenders, and how hard it can be to come forward. Callisto's Matching System is game-changing innovation that empowers survivors and helps prevent perpetrators from evading justice."
Cari Simon, Title IX Attorney
  * ## "Callisto enables the survivors of sexual assault to do something unprecedented: they can discover if their abuser is a repeat offender without identifying themselves to the authorities or even identifying the name of the abuser. They have learned something useful, and possibly helpful, without having given anything away."
The Guardian


Item 1 of 4
![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62a62c551c9e2c1439f64a6e/5f312e95-2c4b-4e4c-9b68-8f3b59ef7bac/Find+Support+background.png)
### If you or someone you care about is struggling, help is available. 
[ Find Support ](https://www.projectcallisto.org/</find-support>)
#### **Contact Us**
Want to connect or collaborate? Please complete this contact form. We would love to discuss how we can work together to create a world where survivors are empowered and perpetrators are held accountable!
Interested in financially supporting our work? Please email our Development Team directly at: development@projectcallisto.org.

### Ending campus sexual assault might seem impossible. But you can help.
[ Get Involved ](https://www.projectcallisto.org/</spread-the-word>)
Subscribe to our newsletter for news and updates!

Ray Epstein, Callisto Ambassador

We had all been fed the same lies— that we were being overdramatic, the behavior was a mistake, the perpetrator felt so, so terrible over what happened, and it would never happen again. We had another trend in common. We each wanted to report, but couldn't do it alone. Thanks to Callisto, we weren't." 
Anonymous Matched Survivor
  * ## "Representing campus survivors, I see how often perpetrators are serial offenders, and how hard it can be to come forward. Callisto's Matching System is game-changing innovation that empowers survivors and helps prevent perpetrators from evading justice."
Cari Simon, Title IX Attorney
  * ## "Callisto enables the survivors of sexual assault to do something unprecedented: they can discover if their abuser is a repeat offender without identifying themselves to the authorities or even identifying the name of the abuser. They have learned something useful, and possibly helpful, without having given anything away."
The Guardian

generated_description:
Callisto is a nonprofit tech startup committed to combating sexual assault and providing vital support to survivors. Founded in 2014 and part of Y Combinator Batch W18, Callisto launched its online system in 2015, primarily operating across over 40 college campuses in the U.S. The company, based in San Francisco, aims to create technology that detects serial sexual offenders and connects survivors for mutual support.

The core of Callisto’s innovation lies in its unique platform, the Callisto Vault, which allows survivors to securely document their experiences and potentially match with others who may have encountered the same perpetrator. This way, survivors can gather strength in their shared experiences, fostering a sense of community and increasing accountability for serial offenders.

In 2020, Callisto expanded its offerings by integrating legal services with its matching escrow system, ensuring comprehensive support for survivors during a delicate time. This dual approach equips users not only with a safe space to report but also with legal avenues to explore if they choose to take action against their assailants.

With a small but dedicated team of just seven employees, Callisto has an ambitious mission: to extend its resources to every survivor in the country, facilitating a safer environment on campuses and ultimately reducing incidents of sexual assault.

Their overarching message is clear: Callisto exists to empower survivors and provide them with the tools and support they need to reclaim their narratives, making a significant stride toward a world where sexual violence is systematically addressed and perpetrators held accountable.

Visit [Callisto's website](https://www.projectcallisto.org) to learn more about their work, find support, or get involved in their mission.
